value: I don't know if you heard about this
there were there was a family called the
bars and they had fostered a few kids in
their home and the Children's Aid
Society worker came around and found out
that the bars were not specifically
encouraging the kids to believe in the
Easter Bunny and as a result the kids
got removed from these people's care the
Children's Aid Society decided that it
was so important that this family
encourage the false belief in the Easter
Bunny that this family had basically
their lives ruined from what I can tell
their foster home was shut down and
they've had to fight a court battle
about this now I had to fight right I
suppose you could say they didn't have
to they didn't have to defend themselves
but when you are subject to something so
outrageous as what the bar family was
subject to I would say it is almost a
moral imperative to fight it and this is
the problem this is what's happening
with the ideological subversion of
Canada is that the process is the
punishment these people thought the
removal of the children from their
foster home on these outrageous grounds
that they were required somehow to
spread the myth of the Easter Bunny to
their foster children they fought it and
they won they won so a lot of people
might sit back and say well there you go
justice was done what are you
complaining about this is a non-issue
and I would suggest to you that anybody
saying that has absolutely no
understanding of what it might be like
to go through a court battle in this
country because the process is the
punishment
that it is far less painful in Canada to
just submit to these ideological bullies
upsetting your life it's easier to
submit than it is to go through a court
process to try to get your rights
enforced and that is sad and pathetic I
totally screwed this up
shows you you shouldn't talk and paint
really so I'm very I I was flabbergasted
when I read this story the other night
because I've used and I recently did use
Santa Claus the myth of Santa Claus as
an example in one of my videos for to
talk about gas lighting and how it's
like baked into the cake of this culture
we live in you you're faced with a
choice as a parent of whether or not to
perpetuate this lie that is Santa Claus
for the sake of going along with the
culture for the sake of being a little
more comfortable for the for the sake of
of spreading the magic to the children
I'm gonna say that I as when I became a
mother I didn't want to tell my child
the lie of Santa Claus I didn't and my
own mother was the person who talked me
into doing it she said I should not rob
a child of that magic that it was cruel
to you know remove that choice remove
that option of believing in magic from
my child and I succumbed because you
know you look out at what what your
kid's life is gonna be like if they
don't believe in Santa then then you're
asking them to not only forego the magic
but they're gonna have to you know go to
school and bite their tongue and maybe
it's just too much stress for kids so I
went along with it in the end I decided
okay alright alright I'll play along
with this
sant√© thing because I'm not a curmudgeon
I'm not the Grinch you know but quite
quite frankly it's it's just a little
it's it's uncomfortable for me to think
about lying to kids this way and
obviously for this family
this foster family they didn't want to
tell their kids their foster kids that
there was an Easter Bunny
they say for religious reasons but what
reason do you need why does it have to
be religious reasons why does it have to
be any reason that you've decided hey
that's just some cultural phenomenon and
I don't want to go along with it if if
that family were Jewish and those were
Jewish foster kids would they would this
have come up just because that family
was Christian doesn't mean that they
should have to participate in the
totally commercial enterprise of Santa
or the Easter Bunny so I I I think the
bars are kind of heroes of this culture
I know they won't be looked at that way
and probably probably no one has even
heard of them because it's been in the
news but I don't think people take this
sort of thing seriously and maybe I'm
kind of weirdo for taking it so
seriously
